question: Who among the following was the head of the Arbital Tribunal set up at the time of Indiaâ€™s independence?
explanation: William Patrick Spens was a British lawyer. He served the post of the Chief Justice of India from 1943 to 1947. From the year 1947 to 1948 he served as the chairman of the Arbital Tribunal which was set up for the Indian judges disagreeing over the concept and substance of the Partition of India.
